review:
It's sad when great games like this are ruined by GREED from companies like BLIZZARD and ACTIVISION.

Blizzard/Activision could've easily just kept selling Overwatch 1, and just made other products with the awesome property they have.  Make t-shirts, plushies... hell, make a freaking animated show like Arcane (League of Legends)!  You had and awesome game with beloved characters and world.  You greedy, greedy, a-holes.

And you wait until it's dead to finally put it on the most popular, most necessary launcher (Steam) to try and save it?!  What a bunch of jerks.

Give your money to a developer that deserves it like:

Ghost Ship Games (Deep Rock Galactic) *Free battle pass that cycles the items you didn't acquire into the game after the season anyway*

Larian Studios (Baldur's Gate 3) *No microtransactions, just a great complete game for $60*

Hello Games (No Man's Sky). *Realized their mistakes and got to work on fixing them successfully.  Blizzard on the other hand will milk the "mistakes" as long as they can until it's almost too late, and then try to say sorry with a half-ass update, milk that, and repeat until the game is dead and they got your money anyway.
I want to kill myself because of this game

Worse than Overwatch 1 in every way.

It's not the best game anymore with microtransactions being the main focus of the game but...
The gameplay is still one of the most fluid, smooth and fun aspect of the game.

i love overwatch. despite all that's happened, i've been very positive about the game. however, sending $40 on something and then not receiving it is a HUGE roblem and based on that alone, i cannot recommend other people get this game right now.

UPDATE: i finally got it... 20 hours later. i don't even think the issue itself is fixed, i just got lucky.
The good news? Everything wrong with this game can be fixed.

I write this review mainly for my friend who probably will spending hours into this game
I've been into Overwatch since 2016 as well from beta. Truth is Overwatch is a really polished game with tons of unique of characters and animation, each were foundation of their personality. in short the game is excellent of raw materials.
Too bad it was controlled by Activision Blizzard, these are the greediest video game company that ever existed aside from EA. 
The original developer are quit from Blizzard due to its controversial which is stupid considering this game is based on diversity.

Overall we as a original player, are totally disappointed more than word could describe. its just not worth it to put hours into the game that basically just aiming for your wallet. There were bunch a lot of things of what makes this game not enjoyable as it did in 2016. But the current situation are just ugly.
